item.title: Supermarket trolley and e scooter chucked in river, 20th July
item.description:
The Sainsbury's trolley I reported ages ago on the trolley wise app (along with all the others dumped on Pilgrove way ) in the river Chelt along with an e scooter Voi one. There are others by the railings that children were trying to chuck over in to the he water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: QUESTION : Will there be a second 'No Entry' sign at the new bust stop ?, 20th July
item.description:
QUESTION : Will there be a second 'No Entry' sign at the new bust stop ? Currently there is only one, sited between the bus layby and Cheltenham Road. Anyone unfamiliar with the traffic light arrangement approaching from Pirton Lane *might* think they cannot turn right at the traffic lights (towards Tesco). Would a second 'No Entry' sign on the Pirton Lane / houses side of the layby help clarify that the 'No Entry' is for the bus layby *only* ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Why has the bin still not been replaced, 19th July
item.description:
I have reported this bin missing before and despite tripping on the pole left sticking out, this bin has still not been replaced for the community. There has been an increase of rubbish around the area including accross the river bank. This rubbish has spilled onto river

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 163, Carter Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: ASH trees on Glenfall Way, 19th July
item.description:
We are concerned about the condition of the three ash trees at the side of our property at 1 Hartlebury Way, Charlton Kings,Cheltenham,GL52 6YB. The trees are on the roadside verge of Glenfall Way and have branches which overhang our property.They are in full leaf now,with brown spots on the leaves,but have bare branch ends which break off and drop onto the road ,public footpath and our house roof. We are concerned that our house could be damaged by the trees which are quite old. We would be pleased if you could arrange to inspect them and take appropriate action. Regards, P&G Tottman
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hartlebury Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.title: Yet more fly tipping here!!!!, 19th July
item.description:
Why do Cheltenham Borough Council let this criminal offence, fly tipping, occur in this location every week? It’s been like this for years. Why do CBC think it’s acceptable for local residents to have to have rubbish repeatedly dumped in this area?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Pates Avenue, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
